sentences.en: Amy buckled the belt around her waist.
Chopsticks made of celluloid buckle easily in hot water.
sentences.cn: 赛璐璐筷子在热水中容易弯曲.

sentences.en: He fears if he relaxes the joints they will buckle.
sentences.cn: 他只怕关节万一放松了,就会弯下去.

sentences.en: He found it hard to buckle down.
sentences.cn: 他很难专心做一样事情.

sentences.en: He tried to buckle his armours on.
He wore a belt with a large brass buckle.
sentences.cn: 他系着一条带大铜扣的腰带。

sentences.en: Her whole body began to buckle, unbalancing the ladder.
sentences.cn: 她整个身体开始弯曲，搞得梯子倾侧起来。

sentences.en: If you want to learn English you have to buckle down.
sentences.cn: 如果你想学英语,你就得非常努力.

sentences.en: Johnny found he'd better buckle down and get himself a job.
sentences.cn: 约翰尼发现自己还得下功夫找个工作.

sentences.en: She found it hard to buckle down.
sentences.cn: 她很难专心做一件事情.

sentences.en: The children had to buckle to while their mother was in hospital.
sentences.cn: 孩子们因母亲住院只好事事更加努力.

sentences.en: The door was beginning to buckle from the intense heat.
sentences.cn: 门在高温高热下开始变形。

sentences.en: The load is too heavy and the supports buckle.
The steel pillars began to buckle.
The two ends buckle at the back.
sentences.cn: 带子两端在背后扣起来.

sentences.en: These shoes buckle at the side.

phrases.tran_cn: 系安全带：系上安全带，尤指在汽车内

trans.tran_en: a piece of metal used for fastening the two ends of a belt, for fastening a shoe, bag etc, or for decoration
to become bent or curved because of heat or pressure, or to make something bend or curve in this way
